intro: Notothlaspi australe var. stellatum, commonly known as the starry rockcress, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The species is characterized by its small, white or yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, giving it a star-like appearance. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. This variety is notable for its ornamental value and ecological importance in its native habitat.
